newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Airbus orders to triple-DASA chairman.
newsitem.headline: Airbus orders to triple-DASA chairman.

text.p: Daimler-Benz Aerospace (DASA) chairman Manfred Bischoff predicted on Tuesday orders for Airbus aircraft would almost triple in 1996 over 1995.
"Whilst only 106 new orders were placed with Airbus in 1995, I expect more than 300 new airbus orders by the end of 1996," he told a conference in Brussels.
He said the civil aircraft market for the next 20 years was generally assessed to be in the order of one trillion U.S. dollars.
"We can therefore expect a demand of 12,000 new jets within the next 20 years," he said, according to a copy of his speech.
He said market growth was already underway and could clearly be seen in the rapidly growing Airbus orders.
Airbus is a consortium of French state-owned Ste Nationale Industrielle Aerospatiale, British Aerospace Plc , DASA and Spain's CASA. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
